p:
Expert judgement has previously been used to assign trait values to aquatic invertebrates
72, 73 and plants. In the latter it has been found to correlate strongly with experimentally derived trait information
74 . However, it does introduce a degree of uncertainty in the species by traits table. To address this issue uncertainty values were calculated (Table 3). Traits taken from literature were scored as 1, traits assigned through expert judgement scored 0.5 and traits based on aquarium websites received a score of 0.1. For each functional trait these scores were added up, divided by the total number of species, multiplied by and subtracted from 100 to obtain percentage-based uncertainty values. The same calculation was performed for each species.
